name: simple mitotic prediction
description: This Python 3 environment comes with many helpful analytics libraries installed It is defined by the kaggle python Docker image https github. Train the logistic regression model. com kaggle docker python For example here s several helpful packages to load linear algebra data processing CSV file I O e. What this project does is look at the ability of a logistic regression algorithm to predict the likelihood of a cell being cancerous based on its cytology. read_csv Input data files are available in the read only. Let s see how it fairs when based off of the mitotic state of the cell. Read in the datasetA look at the first five rows of the dataset. Now we can see that a logistic regression model based on all of the cell s cytology results in an accuracy of around 95 when predicting whether or not a cell is cancerous. So after using only the mitotic state of the cell as the independent variable for the logistic regression algorithm it results in an 80 accuracy rate. input directory For example running this by clicking run or pressing Shift Enter will list all files under the input directory You can write up to 20GB to the current directory kaggle working that gets preserved as output when you create a version using Save Run All You can also write temporary files to kaggle temp but they won t be saved outside of the current session. Set up a cross validation sequence to eliminate bias or overfitting of the data. Set the target series and variable. This indicates that the mitotic state or activity of a cell is the main determinant in whether or not a cell is cancerous. Set the predictive dataframe. Drop any rows with missing values and display the shape of the matrix.
script: sklearn.linear_model train_test_split sklearn.model_selection pandas sklearn.metrics LogisticRegression accuracy_score numpy
entities: (('does', 'cytology'), 'look') (('t', 'outside current session'), 'list') (('how it', 'cell'), 'let') (('read_csv Input data files', 'read'), 'be') (('main cell', 'cell'), 'indicate') (('when cell', 'around 95'), 'see') (('It', 'kaggle python Docker image https github'), 'come') (('it', 'accuracy 80 rate'), 'algorithm')
